text: The Japanese macaque (Macaca fuscata), also known as the snow monkey, is a monkey that lives in the high mountains of the island of HonshÅ« in Japan. They live in below-zero temperatures, and they like to warm themselves and relax in hot springs. ==Diet== Macaques eat fruit, flowers, seeds, bark, leaves, shrimp, and insects. Blue Planet, Level 5 by Dinorah Pous P.64 ==Weight and physical appearance== Macaques weigh around 12 kilograms and can grow up to 70cm. They have short tails. ==References== Category:Old World monkeys Category:Mammals of Japan
title: Japanese macaque
